8a645a42-2c0a-4c56-9d68-eaa44b56e994.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the entire Professional Readiness Program®. Earners are prepared to excel in complex and diverse organizations while maintaining an elevated level of poise, polish, and professionalism.
8a645a42-2c0a-4c56-9d68-eaa44b56e994.name: Professional Readiness Program®

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the first level of the Professional Readiness Program (Business 1000, required of all business majors).
Successfully complete the second level of the Professional Readiness Program (Business 2000, required of all business majors).

Successfully complete the intermediate level of the Professional Readiness Program® (Business 3000, not required of all business majors), which offers students the opportunity to earn a separate credential.
Successfully complete the advanced level of the Professional Readiness Program® (Business 4000, not required of all business majors), which consists of 1-1 mentoring by an industry professional.

Required activities include hands-on practice executing professional emails and phone call, mock interviewing, elevator pitch development, and resume-writing and participation in training sessions on professional skill development, including emotional intelligence, unconscious bias, generational differences in the workplace, professional communication, etc.

e16dc5f2-d5d2-4f2c-ba3f-30e3a031e413.description: Students earning the Scholar Academy: Emerging Leader badge have been selected to participate in the Scholars Academy and have successfully completed the Scholar Academy seminar course Finding Your Inner Leader.
e16dc5f2-d5d2-4f2c-ba3f-30e3a031e413.name: Scholar Academy: Emerging Leader

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Membership in the Scholars Academy, extended to incoming students with a strong academic record.
Successful completion of the Finding Your Inner Leader seminar course.
Participate in numerous group-based discussion activities where class material is applied and debriefed.

Apply the five modules of the Student Leadership Practices Inventory through two journal papers by outlining what they have done, what they have learned, and next steps for continued growth for each of the five modules.

c95d8742-f7fd-4e0c-9985-c275d37faccc.description: Earners of this badge have received training and are currently teaching Financial Skills for Smart Living, a college-level personal finance course customized for Iowa high school students. Earners of this badge are able to offer high school students the opportunity to earn college credit through the University of Northern Iowa.
c95d8742-f7fd-4e0c-9985-c275d37faccc.name: Financial Skills for Smart Living Educator

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in UNI Financial Education (UNIFIED) Conference, receive training in the Financial Skills for Smart Living curriculum.
Receive training in the core financial literacy skills which meet the Iowa 21st Century Financial Literacy Standards.

a8fc9c69-734e-4176-9a9d-60997309075a.description: Students earning the Scholar Academy: Global Citizenship badge have been selected to participate in the Scholar Academy and have successfully completed the Become a Global Citizen seminar course.
a8fc9c69-734e-4176-9a9d-60997309075a.name: Scholar Academy: Global Citizenship

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Membership in the Scholar Academy, extending to income students with a strong academic record
Successful completion of the Become a Global Citizen seminar course.
Engage in class discussions and multi-stakeholder debates on the global business environment.

5d2602af-d6a5-474d-b16a-836afcad622d.description: Students earning the Scholar Academy: Freedom to Fail badge have been selected to participate in the Scholars Academy and have successfully completed the Scholar Academy seminar course Freedom to Fail.
5d2602af-d6a5-474d-b16a-836afcad622d.name: Scholar Academy: Freedom to Fail

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Membership in the Scholars Academy, extended to incoming students with a strong academic record.
Successful completion of the Freedom to Fail seminar course.

Participate in numerous group-based discussion activities where class material is applied and debriefed; explore various ways to view failure not as failing, but as feedback allowing one to learn, grow, and become a better person. Failure is the beginning of learning, not the end.

bda01afa-a64c-4867-8985-85219408c408.description: Students earning the Scholar Academy: Personal Finance badge have been selected to participate in the Scholar Academy and have successfully completed the Rock Your Personal Financial Life seminar course.
bda01afa-a64c-4867-8985-85219408c408.name: Scholar Academy: Personal Finance

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Membership in the Scholar Academy, extended to incoming students with a strong academic record
Successful completion of the Rock Your Personal Financial Life seminar course.
Complete a comprehensive applications project, applying what was learned to forecast one's personal financial life.
Complete weekly assessments from the assigned reading "Broke Millennial" by Erin Lowry.

4b3a2200-a32d-4422-bfc1-d1ed33c3dc8d.description: Students who earn the Business Ethics badge have participated in a variety of ethics related activities hosted by the David W. Wilson Chair in Business Ethics.
4b3a2200-a32d-4422-bfc1-d1ed33c3dc8d.name: Business Ethics

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Sign the electronic student Student Code of Ethics.
Participate in the Wilson Chair in Business Ethics Case Competition.

Attend/participate in at least two ethics events hosted by the Wilson Chair in Business Ethics. Event opportunities include: student ethics panel, business community member ethics panel, ethics movie night/discussion, etc.

c8fc572d-472a-4d8a-8b2c-7b3d99100efe.description: The Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program was established by the Internal Revenue Service to help those who may find it difficult to pay for tax preparation services. Senior or graduate-level UNI Accounting students serve as certified volunteers to help prepare basic tax returns to members of the Cedar Valley community during peak tax preparation months.
c8fc572d-472a-4d8a-8b2c-7b3d99100efe.name: Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA)

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete ACCT 4150 Income Tax

Complete online training in the following areas: 1) Volunteer Standards of Conduct- Ethics Training (VSOC) (Pub. 4961), 2) Intake/Interview and Quality Review Training (Publication 5166), 3) Advanced (or Basic) level training (Volunteer Assistor’s Test/Retest-Pub. 6744), 4) Foreign Student and Scholar training (Foreign Student and Scholar Test-Pub. 4704FS), 5) Health Savings Accounts (Pub. 4942)
Use Publication 4012, VITA/TCE Volunteer Resource Guide during training and tax preparation.
Use Publication 17, Your Federal Income Tax for Individuals, Tax Guide during training and tax preparation.
Pass the IRS Certification Exams at 80% or above in the following areas: 1) Standards of Conduct, 2) Basic or Advanced certification, 3) Health Savings Accounts, 4) Foreign Students and Scholars
Sign and agree to Form 13615 (Volunteer Standards of Conduct Agreement)
Gain tax preparation experience through the Practice Lab, the online tax preparation training software, TaxSlayer Pro
Prepare tax returns for qualifying community members during the tax filing season using the IRS’ online tax software, TaxSlayer Pro.

421819b2-025b-42ff-bfe4-ededd82266cb.description: The UNI John Pappajohn Entrepreneurial Center Early Founders Program is an eight-week program with a focus on solidifying student entrepreneurs' business model by identifying the riskiest assumption and creating tests to validate those assumptions with customers. The Early Founders participants formed a solid connection through mentor meetings, CEO Roundtables, Mastermind Sessions, and weekly workshops.
421819b2-025b-42ff-bfe4-ededd82266cb.name: Early Founders Program

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Student entrepreneurs apply to the Early Founders Program by submitting an overview of their business and the business stage. Applicants go through an interview process before final selection to ensure they are an appropriate candidate for the program.
Attend workshops and engage in discussion focused on business development, entrepreneurship, ethical issues, etc.
Engage with the Early Founders team daily through Slack channel and weekly through workshops.
Meet weekly with a mentor for guidance on continued business improvement.
Early Founders finish the program with a final presentation on how their business has grown and changed during the program.

1af3c83e-448c-4b42-88e6-4d5568daa353.description: The earners of this badge peer-review a paper that is presented at the Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference.
1af3c83e-448c-4b42-88e6-4d5568daa353.name: Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference: Discussant

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Review and give feedback to student papers presented at the Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference on International Economics.
Summarize and discuss the papers presented. Give suggestions for improvement so the papers could be published in a scholarly journal.

f49fbfe5-9795-4f1d-9623-2c8e11a8770f.description: Earners of this badge are competitively accepted to present their research paper in front of an audience at the Lawrence Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference on International Economics. They do rigorous research on a topic of their interest. Upon completion, they submit their paper at the conference for peer-review and feedback.
f49fbfe5-9795-4f1d-9623-2c8e11a8770f.name: Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference: Presenter

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct research on a topic of interest, review literature, analyze and draw conclusions.
Present preliminary findings at the Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference.

5687bc0a-e124-4123-aad6-15fac3e8f38b.description: The UNI John Pappajohn Entrepreneurial Center R.J. McElroy Student Business Incubator program is an immersive experiential learning and educational laboratory designed to inspire and educate students interested in entrepreneurship and small business. Students in the program explore, develop and execute their business ideas with the assistance of JPEC staff and other professionals. Students graduate from the program equipped with the skills and experience necessary to launch a successful venture.
5687bc0a-e124-4123-aad6-15fac3e8f38b.name: RJ McElroy Student Business Incubator Graduate

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Students must apply and interview with selection committee to determine eligibility.

Student is expected to be actively engaged in developing their business idea, meeting with assigned mentor on a regular basis, actively participating in program offerings including workshops, competitions, conferences, networking events and representing their business with external visitors and guests of the UNI campus.
Active and contributing member of the JPEC sponsored student organization, UNI Entrepreneurs.

b2e4249e-b41d-4b80-aaf3-d44b3bd68b91.description: Students in this section of the Professional Readiness Program develop professional skills by engaging in a hands-on project supporting the community.
b2e4249e-b41d-4b80-aaf3-d44b3bd68b91.name: Community Service Projects

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Project Management Simplified LinkedIn Learning course.
Work with team to select Community Service Project.
Work with team to define Community Service Project using project management processes.
Work with team to perform and execute the Community Service Project deliverables.
Present the Community Service Project design, process and results to instructor and classmates live or via video.

67990ea6-6e5f-44e1-88ae-ba37e33e8ead.description: Earners of this badge have worked 1-1 with a Qualified Administrator of the Intercultural Development Inventory® to further develop their intercultural competence. The IDI® is the premier cross-cultural assessment of intercultural competence used by thousands of organizations to build competence to achieve international and domestic diversity and inclusion goals and outcomes.
67990ea6-6e5f-44e1-88ae-ba37e33e8ead.name: Intercultural Competence Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

alignments.name: Intercultural Development Continuum (IDC™)
alignments.description: The IDC™ describes a set of knowledge/attitude/skill sets or orientations toward cultural difference and commonality that are arrayed along a continuum from the more monocultural mindsets of Denial and Polarization through the transitional orientation of Minimization to the intercultural or global mindsets of Acceptance and Adaptation.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the first level of the Professional Readiness Program (Business 1000, required of all business majors).
Successfully complete the second level of the Professional Readiness Program (Business 2000, required of all business majors).
Completion of the Intercultural Development Inventory® assessment.
Work 1-1 with a Qualified Administrator of the IDI® to develop intercultural competency using a customized Intercultural Development Plan.

216c6c7d-57ae-459d-b43d-5074c58e7619.description: Earners of this badge have been trained on using a fundraising platform, participated in a crowdsourcing campaign, and created a portfolio to demonstrate influencer skills.
216c6c7d-57ae-459d-b43d-5074c58e7619.name: Fundraising Influencer

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Training on the CampusGive technology, best practices in crowdsourced fundraising campaigns, and communication plan of an upcoming fundraising effort.
Register as an advocate within the targeted campaign.

Provide portfolio evidence to demonstrate influencer skills: Document all activities over the course of the campaign, organized in accordance with the campaign's social media plan. Portfolio should include explanation/debriefing on each campaign phase and be shared with Department Head and Director of Annual Giving.

ffa9f9ae-fb38-4d16-8966-56c5aa51cc76.description: The earners of this badge have qualified to publish their research paper at the Proceedings of the Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference on International Economics
ffa9f9ae-fb38-4d16-8966-56c5aa51cc76.name: Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference: Scholarly Publication

issuer.summary: issued by University of Northern Iowa College of Business

entity.name: University of Northern Iowa College of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct research on a topic of interest, review literature, analyze and draw conclusions.
Present preliminary findings at the Jepson Undergraduate Research Conference.
Revise paper according to the feedback received from the discussant, the audience, and the editors. Final version submitted to editor for publishing.
